poem:
"Upon the Withdrawn Fleet"

The doubledecker
proud in its metallic green,
now silent, withdrawn.

Electric whisper 
snuffed by the sudden flame, 
Wimbledon stands still.

Under London's gaze,
precaution's cold hand touches,
lingers - uncertainty.

Smouldered in daylight,
its ashes wake the query,
carried by wind's verdict.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "London bus operator withdraws electric fleet after Wimbledon bus fire A fleet of electric buses has been taken out of service after a doubledecker caught fire in south London this week. Transport for London (TfL) said the electric buses had been “temporarily withdrawn” by operator GoAhead. The measure is a “precaution” while an investigation into the bus fire on Wimbledon Hill Road is carried out. Tom Cunnington, TfL’s head of bus business development, said that". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
